2_1CgkYcGEeiovWDTK7RrPcfXMibaKsBFtGp.body:
Greetings from a fellow cheapskate in the UK.  
I've never seen the point of branded clothing or toiletries either.  I pay a little bit more for my home internet, mainly because of their pro-privacy stance (it's a small geek-friendly company).  My current phone is a second hand Nexus 5 running Lineage OS so I'm hoping that will keep me going for a while.

Clothes are mostly from charity shops (excepting underwear and a few other basic items), toiletries from local clearance stores (there's a few in my area), and local Asian supermarkets for fresh fruit, veg, and cooking spices, etc.    I try to avoid big chain stores as much as I can.
